c74object.name: bach.reg
c74object.description: Stores an llll to be retrieved with a bang.

inlet.description: An llll is stored and output, a bang outputs the stored llll.

objarg.name: default
objarg.description: An optional default llll. If an llll has been saved with the patcher through the embed attribute, it will override the argument llll.

method.name: (doubleclick)
method.description: Doubleclicking on the object forces a text editor to open up, where the llll can be edited directly in text form.

method.name: bang
method.description: A bang in the left inlet outputs the stored llll.

method.name: llll
method.description:
In left inlet: the llll is stored and output.
In right inlet: the llll is stored.

attribute.name: embed
attribute.description: When set to 1, the stored llll is saved with the patcher and will be available, to be retrieved with a bang, next time the patch is loaded.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the followings:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message.
x: disabled output (nothing is output)
p: 'portal' output: only used by bach.portal to intercept the @out attribute specified while creating the abstraction (see bach.portal).
The native output is recommended, unless communication with standard Max messages is needed. Disabling unused outputs can be useful if extreme optimization of the patch is needed.

c74object.discussion: If the embed attribute is set to 1, the llll is saved with the patcher.

entry.name: Inlet 1 (llll/bang)
entry.description: Store and output llll. An llll is stored and output, a bang outputs the stored llll.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: If the embed attribute is set to 1, the llll is saved with the patcher.
